Job Posting:167828 - Position: S25 Intern, IT Enterprise Applications 167828 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 04/01/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 03/11/2025 02:07 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City IMAX Corporation 2525 Speakman Drive Mississauga Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country L5K 1B1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Intern, IT Enterprise Applications 167828 Co-op Position Mississauga, ON Canada 4 months CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Job Title: Intern, IT Enterprise Applications Job ID: JR100654 IMAX is not your everyday entertainment experience. With over 50 years of history as a global innovator in entertainment technology, our employees and their careers have constantly gone beyond the ordinary at IMAX. We combine proprietary technology with industry-leading knowledge and relationships with top studios and filmmakers to create theatrical experiences that take audiences beyond the edge of their seats to a world they never imagined. IMAX has revolutionized the way people experience movies and continues to push the boundaries of entertainment experiences beyond blockbusters and into exciting new directions. Come explore IMAX - where innovation, creativity and passion come together. Get inspired, get involved, and ignite your future with IMAX! About the Role We are looking for ambitious movie-obsessed students to join our IMAX Internship Program this Summer! This 10-week program will focus on hands-on learning, skill development, and real-world work experience in a collaborative and innovative environment. This program will take place June-August in our Mississauga office! We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Summer Intern to join our IT team, focusing on Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Operations. This role provides an excellent opportunity for hands-on experience in the world of data management and AI. As part of the team, you will play an important role in parsing and analyzing metadata from documents to support broader data and AI projects. The ideal candidate has a passion for data, an interest in cutting-edge technologies, and a desire to contribute to meaningful projects. What You'll Do: Metadata Parsing and Analysis: • Extract, process, and analyze metadata from various document types. • Develop and utilize scripts or tools to automate metadata extraction processes. Ensure metadata quality, consistency, and alignment with project requirements. • Support Data and AI Initiatives: • Collaborate with the BI and business teams to integrate metadata into broader data pipelines. • Contribute to data preparation efforts for machine learning models and AI initiatives. Identify and resolve data inconsistencies or issues that may impact AI outcomes. • Documentation and Reporting: • Create clear and comprehensive documentation for processes and workflows. Assist in generating reports and visualizations to showcase insights derived from metadata analysis. • Collaboration and Learning: • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand project goals and data requirements. • Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and problem-solving discussions. Stay updated on emerging trends and tools in metadata management and AI. • At IMAX, you will be part of a culture built on respect - we are committed to creating a welcoming and diverse atmosphere across our organization. For consideration, please apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest in IMAX but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. IMAX will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, or arrest or conviction records, in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Change Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the California Fair Chance Act, where applicable. Job Requirements What You'll Need: • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. • Previous coursework or project experience in data analysis, metadata, or programming is a plus. • Basic understanding of metadata and its role in data management and AI projects. • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, with an emphasis on data manipulation libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy). • Familiarity with databases and query languages like SQL. Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms. • Nice to Have: • Exposure to cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data-related services. • Understanding of data pipelines and ETL/ELT processes. Interest in machine learning concepts and how metadata supports AI development. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://imax.wd10.myworkdayjobs.com/IMAX-Careers/job/Mississauga-Ontario/Intern--IT-Enterprise-Applications_JR100654 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
